definition[0]: to shake slightly in a way that you cannot control, especially because you are upset or frightened
example[0]: His lip started to tremble and then he started to cry.
example[1]: Greene was on his feet now, his body trembling with rage.
example[2]: The whole house trembled as the train went by.
definition[2]: if your voice trembles, it sounds nervous and unsteady
definition[3]: to be worried or frightened about something
example[3]: I tremble to think what will happen when she finds out.
